A twist on the popular cocktail everyone knows and loves.

Serves2

Prep5 minutes

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

I was late getting on board with espresso martinis. I love coffee and booze equally, but together, I just wasn’t so sure. That was until I tried blending it up, and now I’m 100% sold. Meet: frozen espresso martini — THE cocktail of summer. For this, just add cooled espresso, vodka, coffee liqueur, simple syrup, and a handful of ice to a blender and blitz until smooth. It’s a cinch to make, goes down easy, and still has that signature layer of foam on top.  If you’re up for it, garnish with coffee beans (always a classic) or even a dollop of whipped cream and chocolate shavings if you’re feeling adventurous. 

Why You’ll Love It

  • The cocktail you know and love, but frozen. It’s the ultimate way to cool down this summer. All you need is a blender to make this frozen version of the popular drink. 
  • Just as easy to make as the classic. This recipe calls for the same ingredients as our OG recipe, plus a touch of half-and-half if you want yours on the creamier side. 

Key Ingredients in Frozen Espresso Martini

  • Espresso: Room temperature brewed espresso is the name of the game here. Since it’s a frozen drink, you’ll want to ensure it’s not hot so there’s no risk of melting the ice. 
  • Vodka: Adds that boozy note you’re looking for in an espresso martini. 
  • Simple syrup: Makes for a well-balanced drink. If you prefer a less sweet, more coffee-forward drink, you can opt to skip this. 
  • Coffee liqueur: Boosts the coffee flavor. Kahlúa is always my go-to, but it is on the sweeter side, so if you do use a different brand, you might need to adjust the amount of simple syrup to suit your sweetness level. 
  • Half-and-half (optional): Contributes to a creamy espresso martini if you’re into that.

Comments

A twist on the popular cocktail everyone knows and loves.

Nutritional Info

Ingredients

  • 1 cup

    ice cubes

  • 2 ounces

    brewed espresso, at room temperature

  • 1 ounce

    vodka

  • 1/2 ounce

    coffee liqueur, such as Kahlúa

  • 1/2 ounce

    Simple Syrup

  • 1/2 ounce

    half-and-half (optional)

  • Coffee beans, for garnish (optional)

  1. Place 2 martini or coupe glasses in the refrigerator or freezer for at least 5 minutes to chill.

  2. Place 1 cup ice cubes, 2 ounces room temperature brewed espresso, 1 ounce vodka, 1/2 ounce coffee liqueur, 1/2 ounce simple syrup, and 1/2 ounce half-and-half if using in a blender, preferably high-speed. Using the tamper if needed, blend until smooth, about 1 minute.

  3. Divide between the chilled glasses and garnish with coffee beans if desired.
